intro: Ophiorrhiza medogensis var. medogensis, commonly known as the Tibetan hanging vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its unique aerial roots and slender, often pendulous stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a waxy surface. Native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau, it thrives in rocky and arid environments.
